simulation

Class PEC

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.PEC

  • public class PEC
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements a Pending Event Container (PEC), where the Events are added and saved, in the correct order in a Priority Queue, and triggered.
    Author:
    Pedro Mendes, Rui Livramento, Francisco Costa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PEC()
      * Class constructor - Priority Queue initialization

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Events event)
      Adds a new event to the Queue
      boolean isEmpty()
      Verifies if the Priority Queue is empty
      double nextTimeEvent()
      Gives the time of the next event to be performed
      void TimeToTrigger()
      Retrieves and remove the first event in the Priority Queue and triggers that event

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PEC

        public PEC()
        * Class constructor - Priority Queue initialization

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Verifies if the Priority Queue is empty
        Returns:
        True if the Priority Queue is empty, false otherwise.

      • nextTimeEvent

        public double nextTimeEvent()
        Gives the time of the next event to be performed
        Returns:
        Time of the next event (i.e., the time of the first event in the Priority Queue).

      • add

        public void add(Events event)
        Adds a new event to the Queue
        Parameters:
        event - Event to be added

      • TimeToTrigger

        public void TimeToTrigger()
        Retrieves and remove the first event in the Priority Queue and triggers that event
